data.title: The Big Bollywood Wedding
data.meta_description: See The Colorful Festivities Celebrating The Marriage Of Aishwarya Rai And Abhishek Bachchan
data.text:
Indian actors Abhishek Bachchan, left, and Aishwarya Rai greet the crowds following a visit to The Lord Venkatesh Wara Temple at Tirupati, Hyderabad, India, April 22, 2007. The Bollywood stars began life as "Mr and Mrs Bachchan" on April 21, after three days of wedding celebrations for Indian cinema's ultimate power couple.

Newlyweds Abhishek Bachchan, right, and Aishwarya Rai, center, eat "prasad" after offering prayers at the Venkateshwara temple at Tirupati, India, Sunday, April 22, 2007. "Prasad" is a material substance that is first offered to a deity and then consumed by devotees.

Newlywed Bollywood actress Aiswarya Rai applies "Prasad" to the forehead of her husband Abhishek Bachchan, as Indian Industrialist Anil Ambani, right behind, looks on after the couple offered prayers at the Venkateshwara temple at Tirupati, India, Sunday, April 22, 2007. The actors were married in a private ceremony on Friday, April 20.

Newlyweds Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai, right, offer prayers at the Venkateshwara temple at Tirupati, India, April 22, 2007. Rai, 33, was dressed in a red and gold traditional silk sari and wore a "mangalsutra" -- a necklace of black and gold beads, and "sindoor" or red vermillion powder in the parting of her hair.

Newlyweds Abhishek Bachchan, left, and Aishwarya Rai hold hands at the Venkateshwara temple at Tirupati, sothern India, April 22, 2007. The Bollywood couple flew to the visit the temple two days after their wedding. At the temple, crowds of fans, media photographers and reporters jostled for a place as private security and policemen created a protective ring around the couple and their entourage.

Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai are seen in a car following their wedding in a private ceremony at the Bachchan residence on Friday, April 20, 2007.

Aishwarya Rai seen after the wedding on Saturday, April 21, 2007. Her post marriage name reportedly will be, Aishwarya Rai-Bachchan.

Abhishek Bachchan on a horse dressed in his groom's attire headed to the venue of the wedding where the bride is waiting for him on Friday, April 20, 2007 in Mumbai, India. According to Hindu tradition, the groom travels on a horse with all his friends and relatives dancing and singing all the way there.

Abhishek Bachchan peeks from his headgear as he arrives at the venue of his wedding dressed as a quintessential groom would at a Hindu wedding ceremony. He has the headgear called "sehra" with flowers covering his face, henna on his hand and he is wearing a "Sherwani." Bachchan's sherwani was reportedly designed by duo Abu Jani and Sandeep Khosla.

Bollywood superstar Amitabh Bachchan at his son's wedding in Mumbai, India on Friday, April 20, 2007. Bachchan is one of the most revered actors in India. When he was admitted to the hospital for failing health recently, his fans spent hours praying for him in temples and even collected outside the hospital. His popularity expands oversees as well.

Jaya Bachchan, famous Bollywood actress and the mother of the groom, Abhishek Bachchan arriving at the wedding ceremony. Jaya and Amitabh Bachchan have acted in several movies together. They played the role of husband and wife in the popular flick "Kabhi Khushi Kabhi Gham."

The bride, Aishwarya Rai and her mother Vrinda Rai enter the venue of the wedding in a decorated car on Friday, April 20, 2007 in the afternoon.

The groom, Abhishek Bachchan, sits on the back seat of his car with his niece, Navya, and sister, Shweta Nanda at the front, before the prenuptial musical ceremony, or Sangeet. Bachchan, a famous Bollywood star, will wed former Miss World Aishwarya Rai in a Hindu ceremony at Bachchan's residence in Mumbai on April 20, 2007.

Abhishek Bachchan's older sister, Shweta Nanda hands over a tray as she comes out of the "Mehndi" ceremony at Aishwarya Rai's house on Thursday, April 19, 2007. According to Hindu custom the bride's family hosts this part of the wedding and the groom comes as a guest with his family and friends the day before the actual wedding. The ceremony usually includes singing, dancing and a feast on Indian delicacies.

Fans crowd outside the Bachchan residence, "Prateeksha" to get a glimpse of the wedding celebrations on Thursday April 19, 2007. The Bachchans have reportedly arranged for added security personnel for the event. An Indian news channel, CNN-IBN reported that special gate passes have been issued to caterers, decorators and others involved in the pre-wedding logistics.

Traditional Indian drummers return after performing at the Henna ceremony at Aishwarya Rai's house.

Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai, seen here at the launch of their film "Guru" in Mumbai, India, on Nov. 5, 2006. In the film, Rai played a supportive wife to a business tycoon, played by Bachchan.

Amitabh Bachchan drives off after a party held for the bride and the groom at his bungalow residence called "Jalsa" on Wednesday April 18, 2007. Mumbai-based newspaper DNA reported that Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai have been practicing a dance routine they are going to perform at the musical ceremony on Thursday.

Bollywood superstar Amitabh Bachchan in a red "kurta" sees off some guests after a party held at his house in Mumbai on April 18, 2007. The Sangeet, or musical ceremony, will be held Thursday.

Bollywood actress Priety Zinta arrives at the Bachchan residence to join the festivities. Zinta and the groom have acted together in the popular Bollywood flick "Kabhi Alvida Naa Kehna." She is one of the select guests invited for the much-talked-about wedding.
